storyInfo: Federico discovers that Arturia could be hiding at a school. In the painter's drafts, Viviana finds a clue to the Witch King cultists' next target, a scholar who interrupts the ritual targeting Ebenholz.

attributes.content: Baron Peter Lukas turns seventy-three this year.
He inherited his title from his uncle three years ago. Six months later, he moved to Karl Schmidt Street due to the expenses of maintaining the Lukas family spire.
He enjoys Karl Schmidt's music, but hates the street.
He finds the sunlight, the flowers, the youth's graffiti, and the jazz music coming from the nearby bar unbearable.
He orders his servant to close the curtains, turns on the gramophone, and the room is immediately filled with the sound of cello.
The Sankta was a truly talented musician, he thinks. So talented, he could almost forgive her for being Lateran.
He plays eleven instruments, ten of which he learned during the reign of the Witch King.
To send the best melodies into the Genesis Spire, talented young musicians were put into a room and made to compose day and night.
He loved the violinist, her delicate fingers, and the beauty mark on the edge of her palm.
Tears flowed down his face when he visited Victoria for the first time and heard music from his homeland on the stage of the Royal Theater. He kissed her for the first time.
That was his elegant, dignified Leithanien.
He misses it.
Trying to destroy houses and escape in the chaos?
attributes.name: Gesatzswächter

attributes.content: There is nowhere for you to hide before the Golden Melody.
attributes.name: Gesatzswächter

attributes.content: Mmph—Argh!
attributes.name: 'Witch King's Echo'

attributes.content: You're the last.
attributes.name: Gesatzswächter

attributes.content: Remove your mask and surrender to Leithanien, and you will be spared the pain of a burning soul.
attributes.name: Gesatzswächter

attributes.content: This pain is... insignificant.
attributes.name: 'Witch King's Echo'

attributes.content: Have you ever heard the Witch King's Reichsorchester play?
attributes.name: 'Witch King's Echo'

attributes.content: The black forests of Einwald, the lakes and ports of Fortsgard, the storms of Sturmland... anything you can imagine about Leithanien, you could feel in the melody.
attributes.name: 'Witch King's Echo'

attributes.content: The Witch King did not interpret or conduct. He simply walked amongst them.
attributes.name: 'Witch King's Echo'

attributes.content: As one of his musicians, you had to follow the guidance of his sightline, and keep a tight pace with him. Fall out of line, and you were ripped apart by the magnificent melody.
attributes.name: 'Witch King's Echo'

attributes.content: The Witch King's favorite punishment for those too weak to serve him.
attributes.name: Gesatzswächter

attributes.content: But I kept up.
attributes.name: 'Witch King's Echo'

attributes.content: I became a part of that transcendent melody. Since then, I could no longer tolerate playing for the mediocre.
attributes.name: 'Witch King's Echo'

attributes.content: What did you think you were? Interpreters of the great melody? Ideal-driven revolutionaries?
attributes.name: Gesatzswächter

attributes.content: Nein.
attributes.name: Gesatzswächter

attributes.content: All I see are criminals hiding behind masks, killing the innocents of Leithanien and undermining her peace and order... Clowns, burying their faces in the embers of the Witch King.
attributes.name: Gesatzswächter

attributes.content: Your life belongs to the Golden Melody now.
attributes.name: Gesatzswächter

attributes.content: But I suppose you were already dead, from the moment you gave up your free will and become the Witch King's vassal.
attributes.name: Gesatzswächter

attributes.content: Agh... hah... haha!
attributes.name: 'Witch King's Echo'

attributes.content: And what about you then? Aren't you wearing a mask yourself?
attributes.name: 'Witch King's Echo'

attributes.content: The Arts you use: the Golden Melody, the light of Leithanien, passed down through generations of Gesatzswächter, those who guard the Güldenesgesatz—
attributes.name: 'Witch King's Echo'

attributes.content: Are you not also a servant of a melody written by a greater will?
attributes.name: 'Witch King's Echo'

attributes.content: Even the greatest individual will is nothing before Leithanien herself.
attributes.name: Gesatzswächter

attributes.content: Then...
attributes.name: 'Witch King's Echo'

attributes.content: Is it Leithanien's Golden Melody that pronounces my death sentence, or you yourself?
attributes.name: 'Witch King's Echo'

attributes.content: Is this your escape plan? Did you think the will of the Gesatzswächter would waver before such cliches?
attributes.name: Gesatzswächter

attributes.content: Preposterous.
attributes.name: Gesatzswächter

attributes.content: Why... would I need an escape plan?
attributes.name: 'Witch King's Echo'

attributes.content: I was... chosen to find you.
attributes.name: 'Witch King's Echo'

attributes.content: The Concertmaster wants to know.... When the events of twenty-three years ago echoed in your ears just now...
attributes.name: 'Witch King's Echo'

attributes.content: Did you see Ernst von Hochberg, for whom help would never arrive in time...?
attributes.name: 'Witch King's Echo'

attributes.content: Or his brother Werner, who died in sorrow as the Kurfürst he never wanted to be?
attributes.name: 'Witch King's Echo'

attributes.content: The Witch King cultist's body turns to dust under the power of dual Originium Arts.
Only her last words remain with the ashes.

attributes.text: You cannot avoid a choice forever.

attributes.content: On that day, twenty-three years ago, Father didn't wait for Mother.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: They missed each other.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: Lucinda went to the spice market before coming to the studio that morning. She wanted to try a different incense, see if it would lift her spirits.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: She did not know that she was already with child.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: Mother went to Sturmland in the end.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: She loved you, and she loved Werner. She could not have raised you on her own if she'd stayed in Zwillingstürme.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: She knew that Werner had already gotten married, but she had no other choice.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: Father had a choice.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: Ten minutes. If Werner had waited another ten minutes, he'd have met Lucinda and known that she was willing to face it all and fight by his side.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: He... regretted those ten minutes for the rest of his life.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: ...I know.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: He never told me, but I knew.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: A marigold and the moon... it was never meant to be. It was a dream that, upon waking, they knew to be beyond reach, words spoken only to comfort.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: Don't you blame your father?
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: I can't.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: We're too alike.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: You told me that he aspired to be a poet.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: But he never once recited a poem in front of me.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: It was only after I returned to Leithanien that I realized... When someone no longer has the strength to face reality, the illusions that once brought hope now bring only pain.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: Viviana...
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: You've been busy since your father's passing, shuttling from Sturmland to Zwillingstürme.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: All I want to say is... it's alright to express your sorrow.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: I just want to rest for a while.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: Just for a little while.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: Cora says no more. She closes the curtains before she leaves.
The darkness wraps around Viviana like a familiar blanket. Cora knows her well, knows what brings her comfort.
She gazes upon the paintings in the room, now covered in shadow, and the golden times depicted within gaze back at her.
Fortunately, the Arts in that music didn't cause Viviana any real damage.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: But they brought back memories of Werner, as they did for us. And it must be even more painful for her.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: You're injured.
attributes.name: Gesatzswächter

attributes.content: I am?
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: Oh... this wasn't from the battle. I might have bumped myself when I went downstairs chasing after Viviana.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: Why not try the therapeutic machine I brought back from Columbia?
attributes.name: Gesatzswächter

attributes.content: I didn't lose my eyesight yesterday, Brandt. I've managed on my own for the past twenty-some years.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: You, though... something's off with your voice. Were these enemies that tough?
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: What an absurd notion.
attributes.name: Gesatzswächter

attributes.content: That's more like you.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: I wish you'd take off your helmet and catch your breath once in a while, though. Even the finest instrument succumbs to wear and tear when used nonstop.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: I don't deserve to rest.
attributes.name: Gesatzswächter

attributes.content: The Gendarmerie is on their way. They'll take it from here.
attributes.name: Gesatzswächter

attributes.content: You should leave before they arrive.
attributes.name: Gesatzswächter

attributes.content: Now? But we're so close to the truth.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: Leithanien has not fallen so far as to need to entrust her future to a blind instrument tuner and a retired competition knight.
attributes.name: Gesatzswächter

attributes.content: The cultists are looking for the Witch King's legacy. Frieda and Loris were witnesses to that night. Werner... House Hochberg was part of the coup as well.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: If they're killing witnesses to complete some sort of ritual, they'll be looking for their next target.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: Which is why you need to listen to me and stop your investigation.
attributes.name: Gesatzswächter

attributes.content: What about you, Brandt? You were there on the day of the coup too...
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: I am a guardian of Leithanien's will. A few Witch King worshippers won't get me.
attributes.name: Gesatzswächter

attributes.content: Besides, they laid an ambush for you here. You're the ones they're targeting.
attributes.name: Gesatzswächter

attributes.content: But how did they know we were coming? Could Viviana really be right, and Frieda's paintings hold an important clue?
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: I believe so.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: Herr Reiner, please allow me to continue the investigation. I want to know what Frau Seemann left behind.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: You're... holding the draft to her final work.
attributes.name: Gesatzswächter

attributes.content: 'Regret.'
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: The strongest emotion and desire that the painter had ever felt in her life.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: She spent her last days painting it over and over again.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: Through the strokes of her brush, she wanted to see the divine in her heart.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: You're saying those haphazard strokes were intentional?
attributes.name: Gesatzswächter

attributes.content: Ja. It looks messy because she painted on the same sheet over and over again.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: The scene of the Witch King's death is still in the draft.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: Put the painting on the ground, Viviana.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: Okay.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: Brandt, try to 'play' it.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: Tell me when to stop.
attributes.name: Gesatzswächter

attributes.content: It's vibrating, like a musical instrument.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: There are minute differences in each layer of paint.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: I can't see, but my Arts allow me to 'hear' the frequency of each layer.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: Almost there... just remove the layer of paint above, and we'll find...
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: The very first version.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: Do you see it?
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: It's blurry, but I can tell that it's the interior of a spire. It's... imposing.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: The Witch King's Spire. I imagine that even Frieda could only paint a small part of it.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: Can you identify the figures in the painting?
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: There is no Witch King. The throne is empty. The battle seems to be over.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: The painter herself, Frieda Seemann, is behind the curtain.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: There is a Liberi soldier charging in from the hallway... Loris Bordin?
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: And... um...
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: Who is this Caprinae holding an Arts unit and cleaning up?
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: Gerhard Hoffmann.
attributes.name: Gesatzswächter

attributes.content: One of the most talented casters in all of Einwald, formerly in service to House Urtica.
attributes.name: Gesatzswächter

attributes.content: He became a teacher after the Witch King's death.
attributes.name: Gesatzswächter

attributes.content: We were late.
attributes.name: Micha

attributes.content: These lunatics don't care how many innocents they kill.
attributes.name: Micha

attributes.content: *cough*... *cough*.
attributes.name: Noble Attendant

attributes.content: You're injured. I can treat your wounds.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Danke.
attributes.name: Noble Attendant

attributes.content: Where is Baron Lukas? Is he upstairs?
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: The Baron... didn't make it.
attributes.name: Noble Attendant

attributes.content: He'd been talking about moving for a while. We wouldn't have gotten caught up in all this if we hadn't put the plans on hold just because of that Sankta cellist playing in the area!
attributes.name: Noble Attendant

attributes.content: What did their performance sound like?
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Do you want to hear it? The Baron had me record it. I wonder if the gramophone's still alright...
attributes.name: Noble Attendant

attributes.content: Huh, you actually found a clue.
attributes.name: Micha

attributes.content: Loris Bordin found it.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Is it Arturia?
attributes.name: Micha

attributes.content: Yes.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: I may not be able to recognize a live performance or not, but I would never mistake her playing.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Aren't we in trouble then?!
attributes.name: Micha

attributes.content: No need to fear. There are no Arts in the recording, and she isn't nearby. Someone broadcasted her performance on this street a few minutes ago.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: And her Arts worked over such a large area?
attributes.name: Micha

attributes.content: She must have accomplices. It would only be possible through a combination of Leithanian Arts and her own.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: You can tell all that just from listening to this?
attributes.name: Micha

attributes.content: This section here. It's not the sound of a cello. It's a pipe organ, and one of uncommon size.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: A huge pipe organ...
attributes.name: Micha

attributes.content: It's an unusual instrument. Where might you find one in Zwillingstürme?
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: ...Ludwigs-Universität.
attributes.name: Micha

attributes.content: A school?
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Ja. It used to be the spire of learning for House Urtica.
attributes.name: Micha

attributes.content: His head hurts.
He has not felt such pain since he escaped Vyseheim.
When was the last time it hurt so much that he wanted to scream, to vomit, to cry?
It was...
He could remember. He just didn't want to.
...Say something.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Gloat, why don't you? You're on the cusp of victory, after I've kept you trapped in my head for so long.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: When I die... I sure hope I get a proper death.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Unlike you, who's been dead long enough to crumble to dust, only to be pieced back together and brought back to life.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: What is he babbling about?
attributes.name: Cranky Old Man

attributes.content: You haven't started the ritual yet, have you?
attributes.name: Cranky Old Man

attributes.content: Not yet, Professor.
He looks like he's in pain. Can he really take it?
He's from Herkunftshorn's bloodline. If he can't take even this much, then Ewigegnade must have intentionally raised him to be useless.
attributes.name: Cranky Old Man

attributes.content: He's suffered much for his age.
If he's unable to bear it, interrupting the performance of the Voice of Mundane could cause the Genesis Horn to go out of control and affect all of Ludwig.
I'm here. The spire will hold.
attributes.name: Cranky Old Man

attributes.content: But you swore an oath to Her Majesty that you would not reveal the true extent of your powers. She'd have to answer to the nobles if the students learned of your identity.
Ludwigs-Universität may be shut down, which would affect your relocation plans.
And Ermi will give you an earful when she gets back to Leithanien.
...Bah. Keeping this boy alive is harder than summoning the Genesis Horn.
attributes.name: Cranky Old Man

attributes.content: Where is Lessing?
attributes.name: Cranky Old Man

attributes.content: He's standing watch outside.
He said he'll ensure that no one can enter before the ritual is complete.
Pah, nothing more than keeping his mind from being torn to pieces. Where is the device I made for those nutjobs in Bolívar?
attributes.name: Cranky Old Man

attributes.content: Are you alright?
Hah...
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: It's okay. They've left the room.
You're...
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: We met not too long ago.
attributes.name: Gerhard

attributes.content: Forest... Park...
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Ja. I wanted to warn you, but Lessing was there. I couldn't take you away with him watching.
attributes.name: Gerhard

attributes.content: Lessing...
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: He's not evil by nature, but he can be stubborn.
attributes.name: Gerhard

attributes.content: I used to be like him too. But all it takes to change is courage.
attributes.name: Gerhard

attributes.content: Can you move? Try to grab my hand.
attributes.name: Gerhard

attributes.content: What are you doing, Gerhard?!
attributes.name: Cranky Old Man

attributes.content: I'm sorry, Professor.
attributes.name: Gerhard

attributes.content: I can't let you use Herkunftshorn's bloodline like this. He's a living, breathing soul, one with a bright future.
attributes.name: Gerhard

attributes.content: Spatial defense Arts— I taught you those!
attributes.name: Cranky Old Man

attributes.content: You also taught me that even the most powerful Arts cannot erase regret.
attributes.name: Gerhard

attributes.content: I've caused a lot of harm with the Arts you taught me.
attributes.name: Gerhard

attributes.content: But when I'm alone at night, I often ask myself: how many souls would have continued to shine brightly, had I not done what I did?
attributes.name: Gerhard

attributes.content: Would we be living in better times? Would the people around us have been better? Would we be better ourselves?
attributes.name: Gerhard

attributes.content: That's why I gave up on being a spire caster and became a scholar.
attributes.name: Gerhard

attributes.content: What are you babbling about, Gerhard?
attributes.name: Cranky Old Man

attributes.content: You're making a big mistake. Step away from the boy—
attributes.name: Cranky Old Man

attributes.content: ...A mistake?
attributes.name: Gerhard

attributes.content: Nein, Professor.
attributes.name: Gerhard

attributes.content: I'm saving his life. I'm not going to miss my chance this time. I'm fixing the biggest mistake that you and I... that we ever made.
attributes.name: Gerhard
